marketNews.title: Government Optimistic Loan Growth Will Accelerate to +10% YoY Along with Liquidity Injection Realization
marketNews.content: The Director General at the Ministry of Finance, Febrio Kacaribu, on Thursday (10/9) announced the realization of credit disbursement from the liquidity injection totaling 200 trillion rupiah which was placed by the government into the state-owned bank holding company (Himbara) in September 2025. Based on Ministry of Finance data, approximately 113 trillion rupiah or about 56% of the total funds have been disbursed. This has made the Ministry of Finance optimistic that the industry-wide credit growth can increase to the level of +10% YoY by the end of 2025 (vs. 8M25: +7.56% YoY), in line with the 2025 target which was downgraded by Bank Indonesia to the range of +8-11% YoY. In general, Bank Mandiri recorded the highest disbursement rate at 74%, while Bank Tabungan Negara had the lowest disbursement rate at 19%. Both BMRI and Bank Syariah Indonesia target that all liquidity injection funds can be disbursed before the end of 2025, while Bank Rakyat Indonesia targets the remaining funds to be disbursed no later than the end of October 2025. See the table above for details of the realization of Himbara credit disbursement from the liquidity injection placed by the government as of October 9, 2025. Febrio stated that the majority of the liquidity injection funds placed by Himbara were directed to the housing, construction, and agriculture sectors. Meanwhile, BBRI stated that they also directed funding to the plantation, trade, and industry sectors. BRIS stated it will prioritize fund disbursement to government programs - such as Koperasi Desa Merah Putih and Free Nutritious Meals - as well as financing for MSMEs and housing for non-civil apparatus. The interest that Himbara needs to pay on government deposits will decrease from approximately 3.8% to 2% if the funds are disbursed to the Koperasi Desa Merah Putih program. The President Director of BBRI, Hery Gunardi, hopes that the Ministry of Finance can add placement funds at BBRI so the company can accelerate financing to the productive sector, considering that credit disbursement to this sector is relatively easy due to high demand. Meanwhile, the Minister of Finance, Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, claimed that BMRI will likely also request additional fund placements so it can disburse credit to the property and automotive sectors. Currently, the government also plans to inject funds into regional development banks, with Purbaya stating that funds will be placed into Bank Jakarta and Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Timur amounting to approximately 5-10 trillion rupiah each. Separately, Purbaya asked Bank Negara Indonesia to accelerate credit growth starting in the next 2 months, while affirming that the government will withdraw fund placements at the bank if growth is assessed as weak. Purbaya claimed that BBNI management targets credit growth above +11% YoY in 2026 - higher than BBNI management's 2025 guidance in the range of +8-10% YoY.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Credit growth acceleration can help boost economic growth, which we assess is a catalyst for the return of foreign investor interest in the IHSG. Details regarding the realization of liquidity injection for each bank can be further understood in the 3Q25 earnings call at the end of this month. We assess this needs to be closely watched considering that previously BMRI - in the 2Q25 earnings call in September 2025 - still appeared cautious in disbursing credit.

marketNews.title: Other hot things you need to know...
marketNews.content: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated on Thursday (10/9) that the government plans to implement a 50% biodiesel mandatory or B50 in 2H26, but this discourse still depends on the results of trials. Bahlil also reiterated the plan to launch 10% ethanol-blended gasoline, with the ethanol to come from sugarcane or cassava. The International Copper Study Group (ICSG) estimates the global refined copper market will experience a deficit of 150,000 tons in 2026, reversing from the previous estimate in April 2025 which projected a surplus throughout 2026 reaching 209,000 tons. This estimate is based on supply tightening concerns due to force majeure at PT Freeport Indonesia's Grasberg mine and mining disruptions in Chile and Congo. These incidents led ICSG to revise down the projection for copper mine production growth during 2025 from +2.3% YoY to +1.4% YoY, which will narrow the refined copper market surplus during 2025 from the previously estimated level of 289,000 tons to 178,000 tons. ICSG estimates refined copper production growth will slow down from +3.4% YoY in 2025 to +0.9% in 2026, as the limited availability of copper concentrate will offset the increase in output from scrap. Nevertheless, ICSG revised down the growth of global refined copper usage in 2026 from +3% YoY to +2.1% because consumption growth in China is expected to slow down. Bank Indonesia projects September 2025 retail sales to grow +5.8% YoY, although it is projected to contract -0.3% MoM. In August 2025, retail sales recorded growth of +3.5% YoY and +0.6% MoM (vs. July 2025: +4.7% YoY, -4.1% MoM), better than Bank Indonesia's forecast which expected growth of +2.7% YoY and -0.3% MoM. The Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) recorded that domestic motorcycle sales in September 2025 reached 567,173 units (+7.3% YoY, -1.9% MoM). This result led domestic motorcycle sales during 9M25 to reach approximately 4.8 million units (-0.7% YoY), equivalent to 72-76% of AISI's 2025 target in the range of 6.4-6.7 million units (vs. 9M24: 77% realization in 2024). Bloomberg reports that Indonesia will halt scrap-metal imports indefinitely to prevent further contamination from radioactive Caesium 137. This step was taken after the task force for handling radioactive contamination found traces of radioactive Caesium 137 in 22 plants located in the Cikande Modern Industrial Estate. Task force spokesperson, Bara Hasibuan, did not elaborate on the names of the contaminated production facilities but stated that they will immediately execute the decontamination procedure carried out by the National Nuclear Energy Agency. SBI Holdings bought approximately 1.04 billion shares of Bank Amar Indonesia (AMAR) at an average price of 230 rupiah per share on October 8, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 238 billion rupiah. After this transaction, SBI Holdings' ownership in AMAR increased from none to approximately 5.64%.

tickerNews.title: BIRD Exceeds Fleet Addition Target in 2025
tickerNews.content: BIRD: Blue Bird President Director, Adrianto Djokosoetono, told Kontan that the company has added more than 1,500 new vehicles across its business lines during 8M25, exceeding the initial target of 1,200 units for the year. As of the end of 2024, BIRD had a total fleet of approximately 24,200 units. Adrianto added that BIRD allocated a capital expenditure (capex) of 1.69 trillion rupiah during 2025, with absorption reaching 74% during 8M25.

tickerNews.title: BUMI Announces Acquisition of Australian Gold and Copper Mine Wolfram Limited
tickerNews.content: BUMI: Bumi Resources announced that the total transaction value for acquiring 100% of the shares of Wolfram Limited, a gold and copper mining company in Australia, is approximately 699 billion rupiah. The company has realized payment for the purchase of 99.68% of Wolfram's shares, while the remainder will be paid at the end of October 2025. BUMI President Director, Adika Nuraga Bakrie, stated that this transaction is the company's step to diversify into strategic minerals. Previously, BUMI had issued 2 tranches of bonds totaling approximately 1.07 trillion rupiah, with the funds obtained covering the payment for the acquisition of Wolfram shares as well as loans to the company for capital expenditure and working capital.

tickerNews.title: KRAS Proposes Support Fund Request from Danantara and Plans Additional Facility for Restructuring
tickerNews.content: KRAS: Krakatau Steel stated in a clarification to the IDX that the company is proposing a support fund request from Danantara amounting to 500 million US dollars, which will be fulfilled in the short term in the form of a shareholder loan of 250 million US dollars. These funds will be used for operational needs, including raw material purchases. Additionally, KRAS will apply for an additional up to 500 million US dollars in other forms for the completion (rescue) of the company's restructuring, after reaching an agreement with banking parties. Based on KRAS management's analysis, the company is projected to increase EBITDA by up to 31.9 million US dollars with financing support from Danantara.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Increases Share Ownership in SCMA
tickerNews.content: SCMA: Surya Citra Media's controller, Elang Mahkota Teknologi ($EMTK), purchased approximately 257 million shares of SCMA at an average price of about 400 rupiah per share from September 30 to October 7, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 102.8 billion rupiah. After this transaction, EMTK's ownership in SCMA increased from 67.20% to 67.55%.

tickerNews.title: PT Multi Artha Pratama Reduces Direct Ownership in PANI to Increase Public Float
tickerNews.content: PANI: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua's controller, PT Multi Artha Pratama, sold 178.2 million PANI shares at an average price of 14,075 rupiah per share on October 9, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2.5 trillion rupiah and was aimed at increasing the public ownership portion to enhance stock liquidity and expand the scope of investor types. After this transaction, the direct ownership portion of PT Multi Artha Pratama in PANI decreased from 88.84% to 87.78%.

tickerNews.title: RATU States No Material Corporate Action Decisions Until Now Following IDX Inquiry
tickerNews.content: RATU: Raharja Energi Cepu stated in a clarification to the IDX that the company continuously studies various financing and business development alternatives, including the possibility of issuing debt securities or other corporate activities. However, RATU stated that there is currently no material decision or corporate action plan that must be disclosed to the public. The clarification provided by RATU followed an inquiry from the IDX regarding the recent volatility of the company's stock transactions.

tickerNews.title: WIFI Announces Audit for 9M25 Financial Report in Connection with Global Rating Plan
tickerNews.content: WIFI: Solusi Sinergi Digital announced it will conduct an audit for the 9M25 financial report in connection with the company's plan to undertake a global rating. WIFI will submit the 9M25 period financial report no later than November 28, 2025.

tickerNews.title: SBI Holdings Increases Ownership Stake in AMAR
tickerNews.content: SBI Holdings bought approximately 1.04 billion shares of Bank Amar Indonesia (AMAR) at an average price of 230 rupiah per share on October 8, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 238 billion rupiah. After this transaction, SBI Holdings' ownership in AMAR increased from none to approximately 5.64%.
